alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 05 at 7:22PM CDT until August 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR CENTRAL CLAY COUNTY... At 721 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Glyndon, or 11 miles east of Fargo, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Spotters report quarter sized hail in Moorhead. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Averill, Muskoda and Hawley. This includes Interstate 94 in Minnesota between mile markers 2 and 11. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
